demo.objective: Practice the required PPE sequence before operating.
records.title: Your Training Records
verify.title: Certificate Verification
quiz.review_description: Please review these questions to improve your understanding before retaking the quiz.
stability.title: Stability Triangle Simulation
stability.sim_objective: Learn how load weight, position, and mast tilt affect forklift stability.
stability.step_1: Adjust the load weight using the first slider
stability.step_2: Change the load center distance with the second slider
stability.step_3: Modify the mast tilt angle with the third slider
stability.step_4: Observe how the center of gravity moves within the stability triangle
stability.step_5: Watch the stability status change from stable to at-risk to tip warning
stability.tip_warning: Tip warning — reduce tilt or bring load center closer
stability.tip_center_load: Keep load center closer to mast
stability.tip_avoid_turns: Avoid sharp turns or sudden movements
load_capacity.title: Load Capacity Calculator
load_capacity.description: Calculate adjusted load capacity based on load center and attachments.
load_capacity.demo_objective: Learn how to calculate adjusted load capacity based on load center distance and attachment weights.
load_capacity.step_1: Enter the forklift's rated capacity from the capacity plate
load_capacity.step_2: Input the rated load center (typically 24 inches)
load_capacity.step_3: Measure and enter the actual load center distance
load_capacity.step_4: Add any attachment weight (forks, clamps, etc.)
load_capacity.step_6: Review the safety assessment and recommendations
load_capacity.reduce_load_weight: Reduce load weight to stay within capacity
load_capacity.move_load_closer: Move load closer to the mast if possible
load_capacity.formula: Adjusted Capacity = (Rated Capacity × Rated Load Center ÷ Actual Load Center) - Attachment Weight
load_capacity.disclaimer_text: This is a training estimate only. Always consult the forklift's capacity plate and manufacturer documentation for official load ratings. Actual capacity may vary based on additional factors including mast height, tilt angle, and operating conditions.
